title: Denoising, segmentation and volumetric rendering of optical coherence tomography angiography (OCTA) image using deep learning techniques: a review
author: Kejie Chen (Kunming University of Technology), Xiaochun Yang (Yunnan First People's Hospital), Jing Na (Kunming University of Technology), Wenbo Wang (Kunming University of Technology), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses deep learning applications in image processing, particularly OCTA images, which could inform methods in audio processing by providing insights into designing models for noise reduction and segmentation tasks.
background: This paper reviews deep learning techniques for denoising and segmenting OCTA images, focusing on how these strategies enhance diagnostic accuracy and reduce artifacts in medical imaging.
contribution: This review introduces various deep learning (DL) models and their applications in OCTA image processing, aimed at improving image quality and segmentation accuracy in ophthalmology.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods faced challenges in noise and artifact removal in OCTA imaging, often relying on traditional signal processing techniques with limited success.
technical_comparison.novelty: This review provides a comprehensive overview of recent DL models that successfully address these issues, showcasing approaches with higher accuracy and efficiency.

key_innovation: Highlights state-of-the-art deep learning architectures specifically tailored for the challenges posed by OCTA images, including segmentation and volumetric rendering techniques.
real_world_impact: The findings could significantly improve the accuracy of ophthalmic disease diagnosis and monitoring through enhanced imaging techniques, potentially impacting patient care.
limitations: The paper primarily focuses on summarizing existing literature rather than presenting original research or novel experimental results.

new_terms.optical coherence tomography angiography: A non-invasive imaging technique that provides detailed images of blood vessels in the retina, useful for diagnosing eye diseases.
new_terms.deep learning (DL): A subset of machine learning involving neural networks that can learn from large amounts of data to make predictions or classifications.
